species.name: skiploom
descriptions: As soon as it rains, it closes its flower and hides in the shade of a tree to avoid getting wet.
It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.
It blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees F. Because its flowerâ€™s blooming changes with the temperature, it is sometimes used as a thermometer.
It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.

abilities.name: leaf-guard
abilities.effect: Protects against major status ailments during strong sunlight.

abilities.name: infiltrator
abilities.effect: Bypasses light screen, reflect, and safeguard.
